channel.title: Ghosts
channel.description: For many years, people have told stories about 'haunted houses' and how there are ghosts in them. Those storys had changed into people's beliefs. The question is, do you believe in ghosts?

item.title: Ghosts
item.dc:creator: @eri0nn eri0nn
item.description:
@eri0nn wrote:

No, I do not believe in ghosts.

Read full topic

Considering that im a Muslim i do believe in fact that there are other worldly beings which even after dying there soul still remains on this planet for certain reasons such as wanting to get vengeance for something done to them. I also believe in black magic as there have been many incidents in my family which have been done by the usage of black magic for example my uncle’s friend was murdered 2 days after his wedding and the curse was placed on the woman who supposedly loved him and when he refused her proposal she said that within 2 days he would die and he did die. Not sure if that’s coincidence or…

item.title: Ghosts
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

I’d like to say that ghosts don’t exist, but I am open to all possibilities. I believe that to solve a problem you have to be open to all possibilities no matter how ridiculous they seem to appear at first. A great example of this is the world being flat. If you did not understand the concept of gravity, you would not be able to grasp how the world could be round, as if you were on the bottom you would simply fall off. However, we now know that the world is indeed not flat. Just keep that in mind when you read my reply.

Instead of saying ghosts exist, I tried thinking of how they could possibly exist. Is there any way we could explain with logical reasoning and scientific inquiry of the possibility of invisible entities that could interact with our world? I believe I may of came with a possible solution that allows for that. If you look about us everything is three dimensional. Even the computer screen is three dimensional, because if you look at it really closely it will have imperfections and curvatures making it three dimensional not two dimensional. Now, we can assume that everything in our world is three dimensional because everything is composed of three dimensional objects (known as atoms). Please also forgive me for dismissing superstring theory which assumes there is 10 spatial dimensions. In that case everything has 10 dimensions since everything is composed of strings. But the question I then asked myself was, does everything have to be composed of those three dimensional objects? What if, per say, there was a different object, that didn’t have our first three spacial dimensions, which we perceive and light permeates through, but a fourth spatial dimension? It would exist on our world at that instant because it would have a common time dimension, but have a different spatial dimension. We would not be able to see it but it would still be here with us. Then the question is how can we test hypothesis?

Then I’d like to bring attention to MacDougall’s experiments. I recognize that they have flaw and perhaps no merit, but I believe it is a good example nonetheless. He measured weight loss at the instant of death of some individuals. However, the equipment had some error and people have proposed where the weight loss could of came from besides the soul. I would like the experiment to be done now with higher degrees of precision, but alas I cannot find any repeated experiments of this sort. But let’s suppose that MacDougall’s experiments were correct and there was indeed a mass loss. That means that the soul exists but we cannot see it. Perhaps the soul is composed of this “object” that only has a fourth dimension? This could explain how it can leave a vacuum (confined by the three spatial dimensions the soul does not have). This could also explain walking through walls and every sort of thing ghosts “can do”. Besides perhaps lifting objects and touching people, but perhaps energy permeates all dimensions and therefore we can exert energy onto them and they can exert energy onto us.

Next thing I would also like to bring to light is the multiple dimension aspect. In superstring theory, scientists suppose that the reason we do not see the other 7 spatial dimensions is because they are really small and tightly coiled. Personally, this makes no sense to me. How can a dimension have a dimension? Dimensions permeate through everything and are infinite. You can’t say a dimension has a limit. Perhaps the reason we cannot see these other dimensions is simply because our eyes can only perceive three, or that we are made of three of the ten spatial dimensions. This would really put a new spin on particle physics, though. Just some food for thought on the subject.

Read full topic

item.title: Ghosts
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“3lv3n snip3r, post:44, topic:510025”][quote author=Tutorial link=topic=628270.msg4339266#msg4339266 date=1374887290]

at my old house i woke up at 1am and saw a shadow of a hanging man with another shadow of a man holding a gun to the hanging guys head D;

well that’s just silly, why would someone hold a gun to a guy’s head that has been hanged (hung?). He’s obviously going to die.

i dont know bro but my mom did some research and that exact thing happened in my garage in 1906, and the guy was shot and left hangin there for 2 months before anyone found him D; it was scary

I would do research on any old homes before moving into them…
[/quote]
Most definite. Unless you want something like on Paranormal Witness to happen to you XD.[/quote]

When you grow up and realize ghosts don’t exist, you’ll just be researching what repairs are needed, such as the roof or plumbing. You know, real concerns with old houses and not child’s play.

Read full topic

item.title: Ghosts
item.dc:creator: @Int_Bauk Int Bauk
item.description:
@Int_Bauk wrote:

no, and someone whom’s gullible enough to believe should believe. people believe in ghosts because of coincidence and/or the environment. furthermore, by people passing mislead information around like: “oh i think ghosts are real because my door moved!”, make the gullible people believe, and this information just goes all over.

i mean if you think about it like this: what determines a ghost… if it’s someone who picks souls to becomes ghosts…surely the world would be infested with ghosts and not just 1 or 2.

people can believe whatever far-fetched shit they want, because at the end of the day, i’m not the one attention seeking

Read full topic

item.title: Ghosts
item.dc:creator: @strucker Strucker
item.description:
@strucker wrote:

[quote=“JavaTC, post:19, topic:510025”]They don’t really exist to me, although I do like the show A Haunting. I mean, I’m Agnostic so I could imagine something like them possibly existing, but not like we see the modern ones. I doubt if a human dies a horrible death they stay in the house until a priest blesses the place or whatever. Most people that claim to see them don’t really have any evidence and if they did it probably was more of something of them being tired from just waking up from a nightmare, happened to me all the time after I played Exmortis.[/quote]the intro creeped me lol

Read full topic

item.title: Ghosts
item.dc:creator: @Chrix Chrix
item.description:
@Chrix wrote:

[quote=“kingman002, post:52, topic:510025”]Well I used to live in a big mansion. My whole family lived there with me. Me, and my mom and dad moved out while the rest of my huge ass family and my older brother lived there. During a huge dinner party there (me and my mom and dad couldn’t make it though) with my families friends too, everyone died of food poisoning there. My brother didn’t die, but everyone was a ghost and they took him captive. I grew a mustache, put on my overalls, and this weird guy who lived in a portapotty outside the mansion gave me a vacuum. I entered the mansion and began my adventure to save my brother.

Yes, my life story is cold hard (pun intended) facts that ghosts are real.[/quote]

Epic story bud, you are my hero.

Read full topic

item.title: Ghosts
item.dc:creator: @Kodiak Kodiak
item.description:
@Kodiak wrote:

iz3 legend:

When I was younger there used to be a lot of tension between my family members, when ever this tension was brought about it seemed like that night we would experience some sort of paranormal activity. I used to wake up with three scratches across my right shoulder blade, while my twin sister’s things would be moved around or stacked in an obviously unnatural way. Then a year later when all tension was resolved the activity vanished as well. Both my sisters and I’s doors where locked the entire duration of the night. So, yes I do believe in ghosts.

obv dr phils ghost

Read full topic
